bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, March 14, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison requests that Hench invite Moran - expenses paid - to Washington and Jefferson College Founders' Day ceremonies.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, March 14, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
March 14, 1940

div1.p:
This is particularly in regard to Founders'
Day and your visit to Mr. Moran in Havana. Nothing
would be more timely or delightful than a visit by
Mr. Moran at that time. There will be scientists
here who will be interested in the incident in which
he took part, the play will be given in which he is
so delightfully represented. The whole occasion would
lend itself admirably to his coming. Our students
would be especially interested in meeting him. We
would like also to recognize him in some way at that
time when Doctor Lazear's name will be memorialized.

Will you kindly be our representative and ex-
tend to Mr. Moran the invitation of Washington and
Jefferson College to be our guest at our Founders' Day
exercises on Friday, October twenty-fifth, and Saturday,
October twenty-sixth. We will pay his expenses to the
states and return and he will be our guest while he is
in Washington. Please convey to him this cordial
invitation.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Ralph Cooper Hutchison ex
Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/H
Signed in President Hutchison's absence.
